description: Walking tour of Thamesmead exploring its past, present and future - from its early beginnings to it's creation as the 'town of tomorrow' - to what the future of Thamesmead might look like as it under goes huge changes.

factsheet.heading: About the tour and guide
paragraphs: Thamesmead is a relatively new town. Construction began in 1967 with the first inhabitants moving in a year later. Famous for its iconic concrete construction it became a symbol of the modernist housing movement of the 60s. However those blocks built in the first phase of construction were only the beginnings of what is today an architecturally and culturally diverse town of 45,000 people.
Thamesmead has a rich history spanning centuries. The brutalist buildings which Thamesmead is synonymous for is only a small section of its history. Join this walking tour to learn more!

Tour end: near the Moorings Sociable Club in Arnott Close. The Moorings Sociable Club will also be open for tours on Saturday 10 September should you wish to learn more about its history and refurbishment.
Guide: Sarah-Jane Day lived in London for most of her life and now lives by the sea in Hastings.

She works for Peabody in Thamesmead and the favourite part of her role is showing people around - sharing it’s fascinating history and showcasing the work of Peabody in the area as part of one of the biggest regeneration projects in the country.

factsheet.heading: Golden Key Academy
paragraphs: This tour is led by a participant of Open City’s Golden Key Academy – a course training up insightful and engaging guides dedicated to explaining London and bringing its many stories to life. It is part of a wider collection of tour events created by Golden Key Academy guides for the Open House Festival celebrating their conclusion of the six month course.
Further info on the Golden Key Academy https://open-city.org.uk/golden-key-academy

factsheet.heading: ALL GOLDEN KEY ACADEMY TOURS ARE STILL GOING AHEAD
paragraphs: THIS TOUR IS GOING AHEAD. PLEASE TURN UP OR CANCEL YOUR PLACE IF YOU CAN NO LONGER MAKE IT. (Info added 9/09/22)

Harrow Manor Way entrance
SE2 9PY
